title: How to Spot Signs of Niacin Overdose

steps.title: Look for severe flushing of the skin along with dizziness.
steps.content: Look for severe flushing of the skin along with dizziness. One of the most common side effects of taking niacin is flushed skin, but it may not indicate an overdose. However, severe flushing along with dizziness is a symptom of an overdose. [2] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Flushing can include redness, warm, itchy or irritated skin, as well as a tingly feeling under the skin. These symptoms can be enhanced if alcoholic or hot beverages are taken shortly after the niacin. [3] X Research source If you frequently get flushed from taking niacin, then look into getting a time released version of your niacin supplement.

steps.title: Watch for signs of nausea and vomiting.
steps.content: Watch for signs of nausea and vomiting. A niacin overdose can cause symptoms associated with nausea and an upset stomach. For example, you may experience vomiting and diarrhea. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Identify any abdominal pain.
steps.content: Identify any abdominal pain. Pain in your abdomen may also indicate a niacin overdose. Pay attention to how your stomach feels and note if there is any pain. [5] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Make sure to tell your doctor about this symptom.

steps.title: Note any itching.
steps.content: Note any itching. If your skin is itchy, then this may also be a sign of a niacin overdose. You may notice an itchy feeling in one localized area of your body or all over. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Check for signs of gout.
steps.content: Check for signs of gout. Gout is another symptom of niacin overdose. [7] X Research source You may notice pain, swelling, or a purplish color in the area around a joint, such as the joint in your big toe. You may also notice that you cannot move the joint as easily as you normally do. As your gout improves, you may experience some peeling and itching in the skin around the joint.

steps.title: Notice signs of jaundice.
steps.content: Notice signs of jaundice. Niacin is processed by the liver, and as a result, an overdose may cause liver damage and cause the development of jaundice like symptoms. This includes yellowing of the skin and eyes. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Monitor your heart rate.
steps.content: Monitor your heart rate. In cases when a niacin overdose has taken place, you may experience a fast, pounding, uneven, or irregular heartbeat. [9] X Research source If you have a cardiovascular condition, such as coronary artery disease (CAD), then you are at a higher risk of developing this symptom and should have your heart rate closely monitored by your physician.

steps.title: Look for signs of low blood pressure.
steps.content: Look for signs of low blood pressure. If you already have low blood pressure or you are on a blood pressure medication, then you are at a higher risk of developing dangerously low blood pressure. If an overdose occurs your blood pressure may decrease to dangerous levels. Symptoms associated with severely low blood pressure include, fatigue, dizziness, blurred vision, and the feeling that you may pass out. [10] X Research source Some of the other signs of severely low blood pressure from a niacin overdose include nausea, rapid and shallow breathing, and an inability to concentrate. [11] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source You should never take niacin if you already have low blood pressure.

steps.title: Visit your doctor regularly.
steps.content: Visit your doctor regularly. While taking niacin supplements, you should have your blood tested regularly by your doctor. This way your doctor can monitor your overall health, particularly the functioning of your liver and kidneys. Kidney or liver failure can be severe and even deadly, if left untreated. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Seek medical attention immediately.
steps.content: Seek medical attention immediately. If you believe that you, or someone you know, has overdosed on niacin, you should seek medical attention immediately. Go to your nearest hospital emergency room or call for emergency services , such as by dialing 911 in the US. Some side effects of a niacin overdose are severe and can lead to other life-threatening conditions including kidney, liver, or heart failure. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Treat the symptoms that occur.
steps.content: Treat the symptoms that occur. A niacin overdose can impact your liver, blood pressure, and heart rate. It is likely that your physician will take supportive measures to treat the medical conditions that are presenting. [14] X Research source For example, you may receive supportive measures, such as IV hydration (due to vomiting and diarrhea), oxygen therapy, emergency medications to bring your blood pressure up, and/or life support (if needed). [15] X Research source You may also be required to have your blood tested to see if your liver is functioning properly. [16] X Research source Keep in mind that hepato-toxicity (liver damage) is a risk when you are taking high doses of niacin or when you are taking the extended release version of niacin. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Stop taking niacin.
steps.content: Stop taking niacin. Most of the side effects related to a niacin overdose will subside once you stop taking niacin. Your doctor will likely terminate your use of the drug. Niacin can then be re-prescribed at a lower daily dosage. [18] X Research source
